text: William Daro "Billy" Bean (May 11, 1964 - August 6, 2024) was a Major League Baseball player. Bean was an outfielder, a pinch hitter, and a first baseman. He threw and batted left. He played for the Detroit Tigers from 1987 to 1989, the Los Angeles Dodgers in 1989 and for the San Diego Padres from 1993 to 1995. Bean was born in Santa Ana, California. He attended Loyola Marymount University in Los Angeles. Bean was gay, and wrote a book, Going the Other Way: Lessons from a Life in and out of Major League Baseball. For 13 years, Bean was the partner of Efrain Viega, the founder of Yuca restaurant in Miami. They broke up in July 2008. Bean has appeared on television. He starred in a MTV episode of Made, and he was an actor in an episode of the sitcom Frasier.See https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1467905/ Bean was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia in 2023. He died from the disease on August 6, 2024 in New York City at the age of 60. == References == == Other websites == * Billy Bean.com * * Baseball Library page Category:1964 births Category:2024 deaths Category:People from Santa Ana, California Category:LGBT people from California Category:Gay men Category:Detroit Tigers players Category:Los Angeles Dodgers players Category:San Diego Padres players Category:Deaths from acute myeloid leukemia Category:Cancer deaths in New York City
